meanings.definition: The doing of an act or the performance of a duty
meanings.sent1: Her feasances in completing the project on time were commendable.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was a result of the team's diligent feasances.
meanings.sent3: The cat's feasances in catching the mouse were met with applause from the family.
meanings.sent4: His feasances in repairing the broken fence were like a skilled craftsman at work.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the student's feasances as an example for the whole class.

meanings.definition: The state of being done or performed
meanings.sent1: The feasances of the task were evident in the final report.
meanings.sent2: The feasances of the experiment were carefully documented by the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The feasances of the dance routine brought smiles to the audience's faces.
meanings.sent4: The feasances of the engine's repair made the car run smoothly again.
meanings.sent5: The feasances of the construction project were visible in the new building's structure.
